Porto Pino features long beaches, coves with crystal clear water and pink sand, dunes, cliffs, pine forests, amazing backdrops, and within vineyards, caves, forests and a great deal of culture.
For the great variety of places to see around the availability of a car is recommended.

1. Follow the signs to the highway to 4 lanes Iglesias (will cross Assemini-Decimomannu-Siliqua museum) - 2. After passing the exit to exit Museum DS Villamassargia-Carbonia - 3. At the traffic light Villamassargia a DS for Carbonia (4 lanes) - 4. Near Carbonia continue up and take the SS126 direction S. Antioco - 5. We will be on SS with various round exit Carbonia - straight ahead. - 6. Continue in the direction of San Giovanni Suergiu and cross it. - 7. Staying on the coast, after a detour to Porto Botte finish great bend slightly uphill and out of a DS on the SP73 (ref. Directorate Villarios-Cannigonis) - 8. Stay on the coast road SP73 to the bottom of the T Is Pillonis where there will be a DS for Porto Pino.
